best practices to enable consistency across all projects•Participate in the continuous improvement processes, as assignedMore job highlightsCollapseJob descriptionLead Application Developer

Required Location: Tampa, FL or Nashville/Hermitage, TN...

Are you passionate about technology and interested in joining a community of collaborative colleagues who respectfully and courageously seek to challenge the status quo? If so, read on to learn more about an exciting opportunity with Deloitte's Information Technology Services (ITS). We are insatiably curious and life-long learners focused on technology and innovation.

Work you'll do

A unique opportunity to be a part of growing DAS team that drives consistency, quality, and efficiency of the services delivered to various internal and external clients. You will be responsible for delivering Web Application solutions to support Deloitte Member Firm. Additional responsibilities include designing, deploying and supporting custom products and complex workflows.

Technical Skills:

• Good analytical skills to understand the requirements and lead the team for removing technical roadblocks and also perform hands on coding

• Soft skills needed: Self-starter, proactive, approachable, solution oriented, team player

• Good knowledge or working experience in Agile and/or SAFe projects

• Work experience in designing modules, estimation, task management for self and team

• Strong trouble-shooting skills to resolve technical issues

• Very strong in web development which includes .NET Platform(4.8), .Net Core, ASP.NET MVC (4.0 / 5.0), Angular, HTML, HTML 5, CSS.

• Very strong in C# as development language, .NET framework concepts and implementation and OOPs concepts

• Very Strong SQL Server (includes working with DML, DDL, Stored procedures,)

• Strong in services development and hosting for WCF, ASP.NET Web API

• Strong in writing automated unit testing code

• Strong in SSIS, SSRS.

• Experience with core AWS services such as:

o Step functions

o serverless approach: AWS Lambda services

o Storage services: Amazon S3

o Security: AWS Key Management service, AWS IAM

Monitoring & Management: AWS CloudWatch

• Working experience on Performance Tuning of an application using C# and SQL

• Used Application Blocks like logging, exception handling, etc.

• Have worked with 3rd-party web controls

• Demonstrate ability to apply Microsoft Practices and Patterns

• Ability to provide debugging and troubleshooting help

Support:

• Provide consultative support in designing web applications solutions

• Support QA team with clarifications/ doubts

• Delivery and deployment of the projects to different environments

• Liaise with a learning group to provide input into training materials

• Provide input to standards and guidelines and implement best practices to enable consistency across all projects

• Participate in the continuous improvement processes, as assigned

The Team

Information Technology Services (ITS) helps power Deloitte's success. ITS is the engine that drives Deloitte, which serves many of the world's largest, most respected organizations. We develop and deploy cutting-edge internal and go-to-market solutions that help Deloitte operate effectively and lead in the market. Our reputation is built on a tradition of delivering with excellence.

The 2,200 professionals in ITS deliver services including:

• Security, risk & compliance

• Technology support

• Infrastructure

• Applications

• Relationship management

• Strategy

• Deployment

• PMO

• Financials

• Communications

Deloitte Application Studios (DAS)

Deloitte Application Studios (DAS) is the internal software and applications development team responsible for delivering leading-edge technologies to Deloitte professionals. Their broad portfolio includes web and mobile productivity tools which empower our people to log expenses, enter timesheets, book travel and more, anywhere, anytime. DAS enables our client service professionals through a comprehensive suite of applications across the business lines. In addition to application delivery, DAS offers full-scale design services, a robust mobile portfolio, cutting-edge analytics, and innovative custom development.

Qualifications

Required Qualifications:

• Minimum of 8+ years of related experience as a full stack developer with a Bachelor Degree in Computer Science or related field or 5 years of related experience with an advanced degree

• Technical experience and expertise in the following:

o React with Redux, Typescript, Node JS, Socket IO

o .NET Framework & .NET Core

o Azure PaaS services - app services, APIM, Redis, App Insights, etc.

o Azure SQL and Cosmos

o AWS

o C#

o DDD with Event based distributed architecture

• Ability to travel 20%, monthly travel of 3-4 days to Tampa/Hermitage

• Limited immigration sponsorship may be available

Preferred Qualifications:

• Experience with leading a scrum team

• Excellent written and verbal communication skills with strong attention to detail

• Strong problem-solving skills

• Ability to communicate to business leaders

EA_ExpHire

EAITSExpHire

• Have 2 plus years of professional experience (not including education) as a DotNet Developer using C#, SQL, and JavaScript, CSS, HTML in an Agile enterprise environment
• Are a US Citizen or permanent resident
• Currently live in the Knoxville area
• Are willing to go on site 3 days per week
• Want to work for a SaaS company using cutting edge tools
• Are passionate about building software in a cloud environment

Software Engineer Qualifications
• Demonstrated knowledge of HTML/CSS/JS
• Familiarity with C# and the .Net framework
• Experience with Agile methodology, and use of development tools such as Jira and GitHub
• Strong interpersonal skills, including clear examples of collaboration and team building
• Demonstrated ability to work independently and as part of a team
• Excellent oral and written communications skills
• Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Engineering, Math, or closely related field
• 2 plus years of professional experience, with a concentration on data-oriented business applications (Education does not count as professional experience)

Software Engineer Duties
• Create secure, public-facing RESTful web APIs and user-friendly web applications
• Build new applications and automated tests using .NET 6, C#, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, TypeScript, SQL Server, and containers
• Enhance and maintain legacy web applications built with ASP.NET, JQuery, and ASMX web services using C# and VB.NET
• Help solve complex problems and improve our tool suite to make it more performant, scalable, and secure

Software Engineer Desired Skills and Experience
• Experience with test-driven development and test automation
• Familiarity with design/architectural patterns including Model-View-Controller (MVC) and Web API
• Experience applying SOLID design principles
• Familiarity with DevOps disciplines and toolsets such as TeamCity and Octopus Deploy
• Experience with Docker containers and Kubernetes
• Experience with SQL databases, preferably SQL Server
• Experience with any cloud platform, preferably Azure
• Experience with Typescript

highlightsCollapseJob descriptionJob Title

Sr. Systems Engineer...

Position Overview

Shaw’s Enterprise Systems group builds cutting-edge product simulations and visualization applications that support one of the leading floor-covering companies in the world. We are looking for a full-time Web/.NET Developer to become an integral part of our team.

In this role, the Senior Enterprise Systems Engineer will work closely with the business partners and other developers on the team. You will seek to understand business requirements and build useful systems that help drive results.

We are looking for someone who has relevant skills and experience and is ready to learn and grow as well. Ideally, you will be intelligent, curious, self-motivated, entrepreneurial and organized. You will also be coachable but willing to share your opinions. We are looking for someone that wants more than just a job. This role is for you if you are passionate about creating solutions, crave customer interaction, are excited by seeing real people use what you have built and have the desire to make a difference every day.

The position will be at Shaw’s plant IJ located in Chattanooga, TN but is eligible for remote working.

Minimum Qualifications:
• BA / BS Degree or equivalent practical experience
• Professional level knowledge of C# .NET programming language
• Demonstrate Object Oriented Programming skills
• Professional level knowledge of Angular 2 programming language
• Demonstrate development skill with solid framework knowledge
• Professional level knowledge of relational databases, specifically Microsoft SQL Server
• TSQL, Views, Stored Procedures, Triggers
• Above average problem-solving skills
• Demonstrate production of code based on provided business problem
• Ability to analyze and document problems and requirements that are understandable at all levels
• Ability to communicate, both verbally and in writing, with people at all levels of the corporation, in a clear and concise manner
• Acts as an integral member of a team
• Good organizational skills and time-management skills
• Sets challenging goals and works diligently to achieve or surpass them
• Manages competing demands in a stressful environment
• Has good work habits, including the ability to work well and collaborate with others
• Takes initiative, keeps promises, honors commitments, and takes responsibility for own actions or mistakes

Position Overview

Shaw’s Enterprise Systems group builds cutting-edge product simulations and visualization applications that support one of the leading floor-covering companies in the world. We are looking for a full-time Web/.NET Developer to become an integral part of our team.

In this role, the Senior Enterprise Systems Engineer will work closely with the business partners and other developers on the team. You will seek to understand business requirements and build useful systems that help drive results.

We are looking for someone who has relevant skills and experience and is ready to learn and grow as well. Ideally, you will be intelligent, curious, self-motivated, entrepreneurial and organized. This role is for you if you are passionate about creating solutions, crave customer interaction, are excited by seeing real people use what you have built and have the desire to make a difference every day.

descriptionJob Title: Sr. .NET Developer

Location: Nashville, TN or Tampa, FL (Onsite 1-2 days a week...

Duration: 6-month contract - with potential for right-to-hire/extension

Job Overview: We are seeking a seasoned Sr. .NET Developer with a strong track record in software development to join our team for a 6-month contract. This position offers the possibility of right-to-hire or extension. The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 8 years of .NET development experience, including leadership experience, and possess expertise in Azure, SQL, and React. As a member of our team, you will play a pivotal role in enhancing and maintaining our internal applications for this division.
Key Responsibilities:
• Leverage your 8+ years of .NET development experience, including lead experience, to design, develop, and maintain high-quality software applications.
• Utilize your in-depth understanding of Azure to architect, develop, and deploy cloud-based solutions that meet business needs and ensure scalability.
• Apply your expertise in SQL to design, optimize, and manage database structures, ensuring efficient data storage and retrieval.
• Utilize React to create user-friendly and responsive front-end interfaces, contributing to an exceptional user experience.
• Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, design solutions, and implement features aligned with divisional goals.
• Play a key role in the continuous improvement of our internal applications, identifying opportunities for enhancement and optimization.
• Mentor and provide guidance to junior developers, leveraging your leadership skills to elevate the team's technical capabilities.
• Participate in code reviews, ensuring adherence to coding standards, best practices, and the highest quality of code.

Qualifications:
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field (or equivalent work experience).
• A minimum of 8 years of hands-on .NET development experience, with a significant portion of that in a lead role.
• Proficiency in Azure services and cloud architecture, with the ability to design and deploy solutions in a cloud environment.
• Strong expertise in SQL and experience working with databases to ensure efficient data management and retrieval.
• Solid understanding of React and front-end development principles, creating intuitive user interfaces.
• Effective communication skills and the ability to collaborate with diverse teams, both technical and non-technical.
• Problem-solving mindset with a focus on delivering innovative and effective solutions.
• Experience with onsite work, available to work at the Nashville or Tampa office 1-2 days a weekShow full descriptionCollapseReport this listingVaco TechnologyMore jobs at Vaco TechnologySee web results for Vaco Technology   Sr. .Net Developer  Sign in to save jobsSave a list of jobs that interest youCreate accountSign inVaco Technology  Nashville, TN, USA   via BeBee5 days ago

• Working Knowledge of Scrum a plus.
• Experience with Blazor is a plus.
• Experience with Angular or Typescript is a plus.

National General prides itself on offering our employees a robust Total Rewards package which includes base salary. The base range offered for the role is: $68,500 - $106,000 and may vary based on internal equity, and job-related skills, knowledge and experience; among other factors. Other financial components may be added as part of the competitive compensation package, in addition to a full range of benefits, dependent on the level and position offered.

National General Holdings Corp. is an Equal Opportunity (EO) employer - Veterans/Disabled and other protected categories. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of any characteristic protected by law. Candidates must possess authorization to work in the United States, as it is not our practice to sponsor individuals for work visas.

In the event you need assistance or accommodation in completing your online application, please contact NGIC main office by phone at (336) #-#.
Associated topics: .net, back end, c c+, c#, perl, php, programming, sde, software development engineer, sw

in code reviews, ensuring adherence to coding standards, best practices, and the highest quality of codeMore job highlightsCollapseJob descriptionJob Title: Sr. .NET Developer

Location: Nashville, TN or Tampa, FL (Onsite 1-2 days a week...

Duration: 6-month contract – with potential for right-to-hire/extension

Job Overview: We are seeking a seasoned Sr. .NET Developer with a strong track record in software development to join our team for a 6-month contract. This position offers the possibility of right-to-hire or extension. The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 8 years of .NET development experience, including leadership experience, and possess expertise in Azure, SQL, and React. As a member of our team, you will play a pivotal role in enhancing and maintaining our internal applications for this division.

Key Responsibilities:
• Leverage your 8+ years of .NET development experience, including lead experience, to design, develop, and maintain high-quality software applications.
• Utilize your in-depth understanding of Azure to architect, develop, and deploy cloud-based solutions that meet business needs and ensure scalability.
• Apply your expertise in SQL to design, optimize, and manage database structures, ensuring efficient data storage and retrieval.
• Utilize React to create user-friendly and responsive front-end interfaces, contributing to an exceptional user experience.
• Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, design solutions, and implement features aligned with divisional goals.
• Play a key role in the continuous improvement of our internal applications, identifying opportunities for enhancement and optimization.
• Mentor and provide guidance to junior developers, leveraging your leadership skills to elevate the team's technical capabilities.
• Participate in code reviews, ensuring adherence to coding standards, best practices, and the highest quality of code.

Qualifications:
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field (or equivalent work experience).
• A minimum of 8 years of hands-on .NET development experience, with a significant portion of that in a lead role.
• Proficiency in Azure services and cloud architecture, with the ability to design and deploy solutions in a cloud environment.
• Strong expertise in SQL and experience working with databases to ensure efficient data management and retrieval.
• Solid understanding of React and front-end development principles, creating intuitive user interfaces.
• Effective communication skills and the ability to collaborate with diverse teams, both technical and non-technical.
• Problem-solving mindset with a focus on delivering innovative and effective solutions.
• Experience with onsite work, available to work at the Nashville or Tampa office 1-2 days a week.

About the Company:
Vaco, LLC

Vaco provides expert consulting, permanent placement, executive search and strategic stafﬁng for companies around the world, in the areas of accounting, ﬁnance, technology, healthcare, operations, administration and more. As a premier talent solutions ﬁrm, Vaco connects people to their dream jobs and helps leading companies ﬁnd talent to grow their business. Since its founding in 2002, Vaco has grown to more than 35 ofﬁces across the globe, 700+ employees, more than 3,000 consultants and $450M in revenue. Vaco has been named to Inc. magazine’s list of the fastest-growing private companies for past 11 years and is dedicated to developing long-term relationships, life-long careers and creative client solutions.

Company Size:
2,500 to 4,999 employees

Industry:
Staffing/Employment Agencies

Founded:
2002

descriptionOverview

Are you ready to apply your manufacturing systems process experience within a Fortune 200 company, a company with a rich tradition of success, built on a foundation of iconic brands and poised to move passionately into the future of the multifaceted consumer packaged goods industry? If so, Altria may be the place for you, and we are interested in speaking with you...

We are currently seeking a highly qualified Manufacturing Systems Principal Analyst to join our team in Nashville, TN.

The successful candidate will be responsible for supporting upgrading our Manufacturing Execution Systems and plan manufacturing processes.

Altria’s digital evolution
We’re undergoing an exciting transformation at Altria. Led by our new Chief Digital & Technology officer, we’re streamlining processes, improving customer experience, and using innovative intelligence to forecast and respond to trends. Our digital strategy will improve consumer, customer, and supply chain experiences business wide.

What you will be doing:

• Manage configuration and software development for Manufacturing Execution Systems/Plant Maintenance Systems, their interfaces and business capabilities across all Altria plants
• Understand and capture process requirements, match against platform capabilities, develop appropriate solutions focusing on simplification and standardization of technology and process across business operations
• Lead external development teams and peer resources to accomplish agile based release of manufacturing capabilities
• Enable quick onboarding of new product manufacturing into standard manufacturing applications/platforms
• Develop reporting and analytics for manufacturing in coordination with other analytics resources within the company

We want you to have:

• B.S. in Computer Science or Engineering from an accredited college/university
• Proven experience in software development and or implementation
• Proven experience implementing or leading the implementation of MES, MOM, batch control and tracking and other manufacturing applications
• Experience in all project phases including requirements gathering, design, development, and implementation
• Experience with an object-oriented programming language and SQL
• Familiarity with key manufacturing metrics and reporting systems
• Experience with Application Programming Interface development
• Must be able to handle multiple tasks, have excellent attention to detail, and be willing and able to learn new technologies quickly
• Must have experience successfully interacting and working with customers at multiple levels of responsibility in a manufacturing or production environment
• Must have solid verbal and written communication skills
• Must be willing to work onsite in a plant environment

Nice to Have:

• Experience with C# .NET & MS SQL Server
• Experience with design and development of interfaces with business systems (ERP, WMS, etc.)
• Experience with Rockwell PLC/HMI, ThinManager ThinClient, Kepware OPC, etc.
• Experience with SCADA systems, Barcode scanners, RFID, Machine vision
• MES platform experience (Parsec TrakSYS, etc.)

Company Overview

Altria has a leading portfolio of tobacco products for U.S. tobacco consumers 21+. Our tobacco companies – which have been the undisputed market leaders in the U.S. tobacco industry for decades – include some of the most enduring names in American business. In combustibles, we own Philip Morris USA, the maker of Marlboro cigarettes and John Middleton, manufacturer of Black & Mild cigars. Our smoke-free portfolio includes ownership of U.S. Smokeless Tobacco Company, the maker of Copenhagen and Skoal, and Helix Innovations, the maker of on! oral nicotine pouches. Additionally, we have a majority-owned joint venture with JT Group, Horizon Innovations, for the U.S. marketing and commercialization of heated tobacco stick products. Through a separate agreement with Philip Morris International, we have the exclusive U.S. commercialization rights to the IQOS* Tobacco Heating System® and Marlboro HeatSticks® through April 2024. Our equity investments include Anheuser-Busch InBev SA/NV, the world’s largest brewer and Cronos Group, a leading Canadian cannabinoid company.

Each Altria company is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing individuals with criminal records, including formerly incarcerated individuals and individuals with conviction records, a fair chance at employment.

Learn more about Altria at www.altria.com and follow us on Twitter, Facebook and LinkedInShow full descriptionCollapseReport this listingAltriaaltria.comMore jobs at AltriaSee web results for Altria   Manufacturing Systems Principal Analyst  Sign in to save jobsSave a list of jobs that interest youCreate accountSign inAltria  Nashville, TN, USA   via Altria Careers - Altria GroupFull-time

Utah
Company Profile:
Captive Aire is the nation's leading manufacturer of commercial kitchen ventilation systems, and now provides a complete solution of fans, heaters, ductwork and HVAC equipment. For over 40 years, we've led the industry with innovative technologies, unmatched service, competitive pricing, and rapid lead times...

Captive Aire maintains a network of over 90 sales offices in the U.S. and Canada and six strategically located manufacturing plants in North Carolina, Iowa, Oklahoma, California, Pennsylvania and Florida.

Job Description:

Captive Aire values its software engineers and offers them immense opportunities for freedom and creativity while not micromanaging. We value our work environment and provide the best in terms of equipment. This position is specifically for our line-of-business applications. Primarily, this includes our sales and manufacturing software with auxiliary applications and services.

This position requires someone that has a passion as well as strong skills in C# and experience in client-side frameworks such as Angular or similar. This position will be geared towards new application features, refactoring, and maintenance of the existing codebase.

For overall project management, we use an internally-hosted instance of You Track as well as Confluence for documentation efforts. For Continuous Integration, we use Team City and internally-hosted NuGet packages to help better manage our software builds, dependencies, and deployments. We are also using Octopus Deploy for most all software deployments to staging and production environments. Source code is hosted in an on premise Git Hub Enterprise instance.

Goals for this position

• This position will be working with our internal sales and manufacturing software.

• Implement new feature requests and fix bugs in existing logic.

• Develop Web API layer for client-side interactions.

• Improve application usability / simplify existing workflows.

• THIS IS NOT A REMOTE ROLE

Desired technical skills

• .Net Web API / Web service experience

• Experience with Entity Framework or similar ORM

• 5-10 years of continuous experience with C#; specifically, v4.0+ is preferred.

• 5- 10 years of experience using SQL Server; T/SQL, or equivalent relational database.

Benefits

• Medical, dental and vision insurance

• Disability & life insurance based upon election of medical insurance

• Paid holidays, vacation, and sick days based upon tenure

• 401k with employer match

• Flexible spending account (FSA)

• Relocation Assistance

Salary

Competitive base salary with monthly bonus based on productivity and profits.

Captive Aire employees are expected to be independent with very little hand-holding and technical training required. You should be comfortable taking on medium to large projects and/or features and be able to bootstrap them from the ground-up. You should also be comfortable diving into well-entrenched, custom, in-house systems and applications which drive the entire company. We are easy-going, don't have a lot of processes to get in our way, and basically want to deliver top-notch, quality systems and software to run the company.

As part of the Captive Aire IT team, you will have many opportunities to contribute directly to the success of the company.

Captive Aire is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We review applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, uniformed services, genetic information, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

To qualify, applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States. At this time we are not able to consider applicants that require sponsorship, now or in the future, for employment visa statusShow full descriptionCollapseReport this listingCaptiveairMore jobs at CaptiveairSee web results for Captiveair  C Full Stack .NET Senior Software Engineer St. George, UT  Sign in to save jobsSave a list of jobs that interest youCreate accountSign inCaptiveair  Tennessee, USA   via Learn4Good.com4 days agoFull-time

You should be comfortable taking on medium to large projects and/or features and be able to bootstrap them from the ground-up. You should also be comfortable diving into well-entrenched, custom, in-house systems and applications which drive the entire company. We are easy-going, don't have a lot of processes to get in our way, and basically want to deliver top-notch, quality systems and software to run the company.

As part of the Captive Aire IT team, you will have many opportunities to contribute directly to the success of the company.

Captive Aire is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We review applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, uniformed services, genetic information, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

To qualify, applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States. At this time we are not able to consider applicants that require sponsorship, now or in the future, for employment visa status

descriptionCompany Description

ClientSolv Technologies is an IT solution firm with over a decade of experience serving Fortune 1000 companies, public sector and small to medium sized companies. ClientSolv Technologies is a woman-owned and operated company that is certified as a WMBE, 8a firm by the Federal government's Small Business Administration...
Job Description

We are seeking a .NET Developer with Angular and Node experience for a 12 month contract. This 12-month contract will mostly work remotely from anywhere within the U.S. There may be associated travel 2 times per year to the midwest.

In this role, you will be responsible for:
• Build either front-end applications or back-end APIs for consumption by front-end technologies and other applications
• Produce high-quality, object-oriented code, understanding service oriented architecture.
• Work with QA to define test cases and validate results.
• Work within the development standard processes for the department.
• Conduct code reviews, and peer reviews, and mentor to junior developers.
• Participate in project team Agile ceremonies (standup, backlog grooming, sprint planning, showcase, retrospectives)
• Work with other development team members, business analysts/product owners, and scrum masters to build solutions in an efficient manner.
• Provide input into the development and architectural design process for building software.
• Ability to communicate well, both written and verbal, to both technical and non-technical personnel.
• Provide critical thought input into the development process and requirements
Qualifications
• 5-8+ years of experience as an engineer in an enterprise environment
• College degree from a 4 year university or an equivalent combination of education and experience
• Experience working within an SDLC in an Agile environment is required
• Experience with .NET, Angular, and Node is required
• Familiar with multiple current and legacy application development platforms, which could include: SQL, T-SQL, PL/SQL, SqlServer, Oracle .NET Core, LINQ, Entity Framework, classic asp, asp.net, VB, RESTful API Services, Node.js, Angular.js, Vue.js, and other front-end technologies and PHP
• Familiarity with source code repository management, task and workflow management tools (GitHub, Jira, Bitbucket, etc).
• Understanding of security in application development principles and best practices

Nice to have:
• Prior experience with Azure DevOps/VSTS a plus.
• Understanding of Docker and Kubernetes containerization technologies.
• Familiar with Platform as a Service concepts
• Familiarity with a government environment is a plus.

Additional Information

This 12-month contract will mostly work remotely from anywhere within the U.S. There may be associated travel 2 times per year to the midwestShow full descriptionCollapseReport this listingClientSolv Technologiesclientsolv.comMore jobs at ClientSolv TechnologiesSee web results for ClientSolv Technologies  C .NET Developer  Sign in to save jobsSave a list of jobs that interest youCreate accountSign inClientSolv Technologies  Nashville, TN, USA   via ZipRecruiterContractor

this job level is a general guideline only and not a guarantee of compensation or salaryMore job highlightsCollapseJob descriptionDescription

The Public Health Portfolio of Leidos is seeking a Senior Developer to support the CDC OCIO Cloud Modernization program...

This CDC OCIO Cloud Modernization program assists the CDC in migrating over 400 applications from on-premises to cloud solutions.
The Senior Developer is a key asset in the design, development, and deployment of cloud-based solutions.

This role is open to telecommuting - must reside in the United States for the last 3 consecutive years.

Key Responsibilities:

The Senior Developer will:
• Working collaboratively with a diverse group of stakeholders
• Reading, comprehending software requirements, and assisting with estimating efforts
• Design, development and implementation of new features and resolution of defects
• Assisting in troubleshooting software application and configuration issues
• Assisting with application deployments which include installation, configuration, and testing
• Producing technical documentation for new and existing features and application configurations.
• Coaches and mentors more junior developers.

Requirements:
• BS degree and 8 - 12 years of prior relevant experience or Masters with 6 - 10 years of prior relevant experience.
• 5+ years of hands-on experience working with Azure cloud native technologies including serverless, container implementations, DevOps, CLI, databases, compute, storage, security and networks OR similar experience with AWS as well as the Azure Developer Associate certification.
• Developed applications built with .NET, C#, Powerapps on Azure.
• Experience in API programming for data interchanges.
• Working on Agile teams
• Other experience should include 3 or more of the following skill areas:
• Experience with Serverless implementations within Azure Functions.
• Worked with Azure native databases such as Azure Blob Storage, Cosmos DB etc.
• Able to lead developer teams to complete application development sprints and backlogs; able to lead code reviews and troubleshoot code performance in application modules; able to work with UAT automation planning and review test harness code.

• Experience in programming that may include AWS Templates, Terraform, and Bicep templates for automated infrastructure deployment in AWS.

• Skills may include agile programming and Low Code/No Code programming on Microsoft Power Platform and Visual Studio development, testing automation, CI/CD coding as well as functional, integration, performance test driven optimization of codebase and API programming for data interchanges.
• Able to develop and support application development sprints and backlogs, conduct code reviews, and troubleshoot code performance in application modules. Able to work with UAT automation planning and review test harness code.
• Experience in other programming languages: Java, JavaScript/TypeScript, Node.js, Python or Palantir.

3+ years of experience working with the CDC

Overview ASP.Net Web Application Developer needed to provide application development and maintenance services for projects related to the government sector. The position is responsible for the development, maintenance, testing and on-going support of enterprise level solutions...

Major Duties

This position will act as the primary analyst for the implementation and support of web applications application written in ASP.NET applications written in C# . The successful candidate must be a highly-motivated, self-starter who is comfortable working as part of a team (in any capacity) or as an independent contributor. The candidate must demonstrate a strong customer focus and excellent written and verbal communications skills. A desire to continuously improve technical skills and identify opportunities where development tools meeting business standards.

Qualifications

Demonstrated professional experience with the following:
• Direct enterprise level experience with the .NET framework in C#
• Experience with .NET Framework (3.5 and 4).
• Experience with ASP.NET Web Forms, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
• Experience with MS SQL Server 2008r2 (or later)
• Experience using Microsoft Visual Studio (VS 2013 preferred).
• Experience facilitating, gathering and documenting user requirements through application design sessions with business customers.
• Excellent communication, organizational skills, time management and problem solving abilities. While not required, the following qualifications are desired.
• Experience using Microsoft Team Foundation Server.
• Experience with HTML5, AJAX, Silverlight, and jQuery.
• Experience in the design, planning & implementation phases as well as support of enterprise level n-tier distributed applications. Development and Engineering Manager

Apply locations Remote - US time type Full time posted on Posted 2 Days Ago job requisition
It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing!

We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.

CLIP Software is an industry leading business management software within the landscape and lawn maintenance industry and has been for the past 35+ years. CLIPitc is the most recent version of CLIP and the Development and Engineering Manager will lead the inhouse and outsourced development team, develop the software by improving existing features and adding new features, and help ensure departmental budgetary goals are met.

This role is a player – coach role, as the ideal candidate will be able to both lead and manage as well as perform coding and programming.

Primary Responsibilities:

• Design, develop and deploy new functionalities for applications using .NET stack

• Work to refine requirements to enhancements existing or new functionalities

• Actively participate in new code and maintaining current application code

• Ensure design and development standards are current and being followed

• Manage and lead a team of outsourced and inhouse developers

• Ensure infrastructure is maintained and running as needed

• Work with the CLIP team to build, manage, and accomplish the product roadmap

Supervisory Responsibilities:

• Manage a team of outsourced developers

• Oversee hiring of developers and development staff as needed

• Organize and lead meetings with both the oursourced and inhouse development teams as seen fit to cohesively work together to accomplish projects

Budget

Responsibilities:

• Assists in managing overall costs for all development needs

• Assist in budget planning for the R&D department

Primary

Qualifications:

• At least 4 years of experience in developing .NET applications

• Must have strong hands-on experience in developing applications using C#, ASP.NET Webforms, Web API, Telerik tools, and Blazor

• Familiarity with coding standards like SOLID

• Hands on experience using JIRA or any similar source controls

• Good experience in using Microsoft development toolset

• Good communication and collaboration skills

• Take part in Scrum development process

• Strong critical / analytical thinking and problem-solving skills

• Experience with Blazor is a plus

• UI/UX and design work is a plus

Success factors/job competencies:

• Action Oriented & Drive for Results:
Enjoys working hard; is action oriented and full of energy for the things seen as challenging; not fearful of action with minimum of planning; seizes opportunity to drive business objectives forward. Can be counted on to meet or exceed goals successfully; is consistent in performance and strives to be a top performer; very bottom line oriented; steadfastly pushes self and other for results.

Uses rigorous logic and methods to solve difficult problems with effective solutions; probes all fruitful sources for answers; can see hidden problems; is excellent at honest analysis; looks beyond the obvious and doesn’t stop at the first answers.

• Critical Thinking & Continuous Development:
Can effectively cope with change; can shift gears comfortably; ability to synthesize objectives across the organization and take appropriate action without having the total picture; isn’t upset when things are up in the air; can comfortably handle risk and uncertainty. Learns quickly when facing new problems; a relentless and versatile learner; open to change; analyzes both successes and failures for clues to improvement;

experiments and will try anything to find solutions; enjoys the challenge of unfamiliar tasks; quickly grasps the essence and the underlying structure of anything. Deals with concepts and complexity comfortably; capable, and agile. Applies new learnings to enhance productivity and quality of the work without prompting. Seeks and applies efficiencies in day-to-day work, constantly improving and streamlining processes to achieve company objectives.

• Communication & Relationship Building:
Has the ability to perceive reactions via non-verbal signals of others, reason with others to promote thinking and cognitive activity, understand drivers of decisions by interpreting the cause of other’s reactions and what it may mean, and manage relationships by working collaboratively to reach the best outcome for the company. Is dedicated to meeting the expectations and requirements of internal and external customers;

gets first-hand customer information and uses it for improvements in products and services; acts with customers in mind; establishes and maintains effective relationships with customers and gains their trust and respect. Actively and consistently seeks to work cooperatively with others, inside and outside the organization, to accomplish objectives to build and maintain mutually beneficial partnerships, leverage information, and achieve results.

Serves as a…Show full descriptionCollapseReport this listingClip Sw LLCMore jobs at Clip Sw LLCSee web results for Clip Sw LLC  C Development and Engineering Manager  Sign in to save jobsSave a list of jobs that interest youCreate accountSign inClip Sw LLC  Readyville, TN, USA   via Learn4Good.com4 days agoFull-time

Description of Role/Responsibilities...

Beacon Hill Technologies is currently seeking a .NET Developer for our client here in Middle Tennessee.

This person will be joining a senior level development organization and will be looked upon to act as the liaison between the business organization and the development team.
This person must have experience with .NET/C#, frontend technologies like Angular framework and API Development.

Our client is looking for an individual that is able to drive specific project specs from inception to completion and at times drive those specs to the point of proving that it is not possible or the right approach.

This person will also be interacting with all levels of our clients organization and must posses excellent communication and organizational skills.

This role requires an individual that is truly passionate and curious about technology today and how it can impact an organizations ability to succeed.

Required Skills:

3+ or more years of experience with .NET/C# Development

3 or more years of experience with Frontend and API development

In depth experience working within an Agile environemnt and using Kanban scaling model

Genuine curiosity about todays technology to use as an impact tool within an organization

Sr. Full Stack .NET Developer...

Job Location

Fully remote

Job Overview

This role involves working with a small team to develop embedded web analytics. The team is transitioning from traditional analytics tools to building a portal from scratch. As a Sr. Full Stack .NET Developer, you will play a key role in building new analytics for pharmacy data.

Compensation
• Fully remote position
• Contract-to-hire

Responsibilities
• Utilize your 5+ years of experience in .NET/C# to contribute to the development of the web analytics portal
• Mentor junior developers
• Collaborate with the manager and the existing developer to ensure the successful implementation of the project

• 5+ years of experience in .NET/C#
• 4+ years of experience in modern JavaScript frameworks such as Angular, Vue, or React (this team uses Vue)
• Strong desire and ability to mentor junior developers
• API experience
• Azure experience

Water technology is one of the fastest-growing industries in the world. As a leading global water technology company, A. O. Smith Corporation (NYSE: AOS) is at the center of the trend. We are a $4 billion company with over 140 years of history and 12,000+ employees. Our emphasis is on hot water and clean water; we are one of the world's largest manufacturers of... residential and commercial water heating equipment as well as a supplier of water purification products in a number of emerging countries.

With manufacturing operations in the United States, Canada, Mexico, China, India, and Europe, we have the reach to serve customers worldwide.

A.O. Smith is committed to continuous improvement and maintaining a culture that values and respects our employees. Recognized by The Tennessean as one of the top Nashville area Workplaces, we have programs in place to help our team members achieve their potential. When you join our team, you will receive rewards and recognition for your contributions, training and professional development opportunities, as well as a variety of benefits to support you and your family's health, well-being, and financial future. If you are inspired to learn, take risks, and succeed as a team, you can build an amazing career at A. O. Smith

This role is located in our modern Nashville Metro Center office, located just minutes from downtown with easy interstate access and free parking.

This role is eligible for a remote work schedule of up to two days remote work per week. New employees are eligible to apply after successfully completing their initial 90 days of employment and training.

Primary Function

Design, develop, document, test, and debug new and existing software systems and/or applications (cloud and/or in-house). Serve as technical expert on development projects. Participate in full development life cycle including requirements analysis and design. Write technical specifications based on conceptual design and stated business requirements. Entry level position within field. Conducts routine tasks as directed.

Responsibilities
• Support, maintain, and document software functionality.
• Identify and evaluate new technologies for implementation.
• Analyze code to find causes of errors and revise programs as needed.
• Participate in software design meetings and analyze user needs to determine technical requirements.
• Consult with end user to prototype, refine, test, and debug programs to meet needs.
• Provides application software development services or technical support typically in a defined project.
• Develops program logic for new applications or analyzes and modifies logic in existing applications.
• Codes, tests, debugs, documents, implements and maintains software applications.
• Analyzes requirements, and maintains, tests and integrates application components.
• Ensures that system improvements are successfully implemented.
• Develops competence by performing structured work assignments.
• Uses existing procedures to solve routine or standard problems.
• Receives instruction, guidance and direction from others
• May be involved in website planning and deployment.
• Writes technical documentation regarding the website's or other technical requirements.
• Provides application software development services or technical support typically in a defined project.
• Develops program logic for new applications or analyzes and modifies logic in existing applications.
• Perform other duties as assigned.

Qualifications
• Recent graduate with Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science MIS (or related field) or Software Development School graduate; candidates with equivalent years of related IT experience, certifications, and education also considered
• 1+ year related work experience
• Advanced computer skills including programming experience
• Demonstrated exceptional written and oral communication skills
• Excellent communication skills via written and oral.
• Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite; Word, Excel, Access, Outlook, etc.

We Offer

unitsMore job highlightsCollapseJob descriptionSyms Strategic Group (SSG) is seeking a talented .Net/C# Developer

Department: Veterans Affairs...

Type: Full Time

Min. Experience: Experienced

Security Clearance Level: Public Trust (MBI)

Military Veterans are highly encouraged to apply!

Essential Duties And Responsibilities
• .Net and/or C# experience required.
• Performs code reviews.
• Performs system maintenance and enhancements.
• Designs and develops computer systems or programs, including prototypes, based on user defined requirements.
• Writes code, programs, tests, and analyzes new application software.
• Works more independently with IT functional units and business units.

Required Skills And Experience
• 8+ years’ .Net experience
• 8+ years’ C# experience
• SQL DB
• JIRA Experience
• Experience in a high paced DevOps environment
• Experience in large scale Enterprise environments
• U.S. Citizenship required for this position.

Professional Certifications

Years Of Professional Experience

None required however AWS Cloud Certification is a plus

8+ years of C# development experience

8+ years of .NET development experience

Experience in large scale Enterprise environments

Desired Experience

Electronic Data Interchange X.12 (EDI) Medical Claims
• X.12 medical claims (837, 834, 277, etc)

Experience with T-SQL

Experience in a high paced DevOps environment

Experience working with remote U.S. based teams (Not Offshore teams)

Formal Education

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software/Systems Engineering, or equivalent technical degree

Citizenship Requirement

Security Clearance Requirements

U.S. Citizenship required for this specific opportunity

Must possess or qualify for a Public Trust (MBI)

CRITICAL NOTES:
• SSG will not make assumptions regarding your qualifications. Your answers to the mandatory screening questions must be supported by the information on your resume. Applications with inconsistencies will not be considered.
• Recruiters or Third parties will not be considered.
• This is a 100% U.S. based remote position. However, candidates from CA, CO, NJ or NY will not be considered.
• This is a 1099 position

U.S Citizenship is required for this specific opportunity. Applicants selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information and be able to obtain a government-granted security clearance. Individuals may also be subject to a background investigation including, but not limited to criminal history, employment and education verification, drug testing, and creditworthiness.

Syms Strategic Group, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, or genetic information.

projects•Participate in the continuous improvement processes, as assignedMore job highlightsCollapseJob descriptionLead Application Developer

Required Location: Tampa, FL or Nashville/Hermitage, TN...

Are you passionate about technology and interested in joining a community of collaborative colleagues who respectfully and courageously seek to challenge the status quo? If so, read on to learn more about an exciting opportunity with Deloitte's Information Technology Services (ITS). We are insatiably curious and life-long learners focused on technology and innovation.

Work you'll do

A unique opportunity to be a part of growing DAS team that drives consistency, quality, and efficiency of the services delivered to various internal and external clients. You will be responsible for delivering Web Application solutions to support Deloitte Member Firm. Additional responsibilities include designing, deploying and supporting custom products and complex workflows.

Technical Skills:

• Good analytical skills to understand the requirements and lead the team for removing technical roadblocks and also perform hands on coding

• Soft skills needed: Self-starter, proactive, approachable, solution oriented, team player

• Good knowledge or working experience in Agile and/or SAFe projects

• Work experience in designing modules, estimation, task management for self and team

• Strong trouble-shooting skills to resolve technical issues

• Very strong in web development which includes .NET Platform(4.8), .Net Core, ASP.NET MVC (4.0 / 5.0), Angular, HTML, HTML 5, CSS.

• Very strong in C# as development language, .NET framework concepts and implementation and OOPs concepts

• Very Strong SQL Server (includes working with DML, DDL, Stored procedures,)

• Strong in services development and hosting for WCF, ASP.NET Web API

• Strong in writing automated unit testing code

• Strong in SSIS, SSRS.

• Experience with core AWS services such as:

o Step functions

o serverless approach: AWS Lambda services

o Storage services: Amazon S3

o Security: AWS Key Management service, AWS IAM

Monitoring & Management: AWS CloudWatch

• Working experience on Performance Tuning of an application using C# and SQL

• Used Application Blocks like logging, exception handling, etc.

• Have worked with 3rd-party web controls

• Demonstrate ability to apply Microsoft Practices and Patterns

• Ability to provide debugging and troubleshooting help

Support:

• Provide consultative support in designing web applications solutions

• Support QA team with clarifications/ doubts

• Delivery and deployment of the projects to different environments

• Liaise with a learning group to provide input into training materials

• Provide input to standards and guidelines and implement best practices to enable consistency across all projects

• Participate in the continuous improvement processes, as assigned

The Team

Information Technology Services (ITS) helps power Deloitte's success. ITS is the engine that drives Deloitte, which serves many of the world's largest, most respected organizations. We develop and deploy cutting-edge internal and go-to-market solutions that help Deloitte operate effectively and lead in the market. Our reputation is built on a tradition of delivering with excellence.

The 2,200 professionals in ITS deliver services including:

• Security, risk & compliance

• Technology support

• Infrastructure

• Applications

• Relationship management

• Strategy

• Deployment

• PMO

• Financials

• Communications

Deloitte Application Studios (DAS)

Deloitte Application Studios (DAS) is the internal software and applications development team responsible for delivering leading-edge technologies to Deloitte professionals. Their broad portfolio includes web and mobile productivity tools which empower our people to log expenses, enter timesheets, book travel and more, anywhere, anytime. DAS enables our client service professionals through a comprehensive suite of applications across the business lines. In addition to application delivery, DAS offers full-scale design services, a robust mobile portfolio, cutting-edge analytics, and innovative custom development.

Qualifications

Required Qualifications:

• Minimum of 8+ years of related experience as a full stack developer with a Bachelor Degree in Computer Science or related field or 5 years of related experience with an advanced degree

• Technical experience and expertise in the following:

o React with Redux, Typescript, Node JS, Socket IO

o .NET Framework & .NET Core

o Azure PaaS services - app services, APIM, Redis, App Insights, etc.

o Azure SQL and Cosmos

o AWS

o C#

o DDD with Event based distributed architecture

• Ability to travel 20%, monthly travel of 3-4 days to Tampa/Hermitage

• Limited immigration sponsorship may be available

Preferred Qualifications:

• Experience with leading a scrum team

• Excellent written and verbal communication skills with strong attention to detail

• Strong problem-solving skills

• Ability to communicate to business leaders

EA_ExpHire

EAITSExpHire

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable lawShow full descriptionCollapseReport this listingDeloittedeloitte.comMore jobs at DeloitteSee web results for Deloitte   Lead Application Developer - DAS Audit Project Omnia  Sign in to save jobsSave a list of jobs that interest youCreate accountSign inDeloitte  Tennessee, USA   via Deloitte JobsFull-time

Here are the job position details for your review...

Job Title: C#.NET Software Engineer
Pay Rate: $35 to 37/Hr
Duration: 12 Months
Location: Johnson City, TN (On-Site)

This position is for the Factory Automation division.

C#.NET Software Engineer's primary responsibility will be to develop and test Software solutions on a Windows-based C# desktop application.

The job will be 5 days a week (40 hours) in the office, in Johnson City, TN for the first several months. After that, there can be a negotiation about splitting time (say 3 days a week in the office). But fully remote work, from day 1, is not an option.
• Develops software.
• Reviews relevant requirements, standards, and other documentation to clarify and understand software engineering requirements.
• Provides estimates for modules under development, and estimates own work.
• Completes the development of software test requirements for modules under development.
• Executes software (unit and integration) tests.
• Presents technical findings and developments.
• Adheres to the software quality process through the execution of module, subsystem, and system test procedures.
• Analyzes localization requirements and designs/adapts products and solutions accordingly.
• Agile/Lean software development process.

Requirements:
• BS Computer Science or Computer Engineering
• Demonstrate good interpersonal, communication, and teamwork skills
• Proficient in C# programming language and object-oriented design methodology (NOT SELF-TAUGHT)
• Self-motivated and results-oriented

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Salary: $35.00 - $37.00 per hour

Experience level:
• 2 years

Schedule:
• 8 hour shift

Ability to commute/relocate:
• Johnson City, TN 37604: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

Application Question(s):
• This is a W2 position
• please provide your email address

Education:
• Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:
• C#.Net: 2 years (Required)
• OOP: 2 years (Required)

based on qualificationsMore job highlightsCollapseJob descriptionLive IT Up at Ciber Global
At Ciber Global, we believe the most inspired, innovative and industrious companies should win, regardless of size or legacy. We're the small company that cares and the big company that can. We deliver breakthrough performances and powerful solutions that are anything but cookie cutter in order to give our clients the competitive advantage they deserve.
Work...
Role Description:
Ciber Global is seeking a .Net developer that will be responsible for providing software development and maintenance of applications for corporate initiatives in Nashville, TN.
Responsibilities:
Development responsibilities will include providing solutions that follow development standards, integrate with other systems and that fulfill business requirements.
Responsibilities will include system enhancements, new system code development, web-based and windows-based application development, systems conversions, reporting services and other technical efforts requiring software development.
Provide production support of business applications, which includes resolving issues and removing defects by priority and severity.
Develop software solutions following established development standards.
Develop software that integrates with other systems.
Participate in planning and prioritization sessions and provide estimates.
Unit test each software component to ensure business requirements are fulfilled.
Ensure that all application artifacts are archived in a code repository.
Complete assignments in a timely and accurate manner and proactively escalate any risks to management.
Provide consistent and concise status reports as requested by management.
Perform other duties and job functions as requested by management.
Skills/
Experience:
5 years of experience in software development for business systems
Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience
Must have experience in ASP.NET, C#, JavaScript, jQuery, Visual Studio, Ajax, SSRS, SQL Server, Responsive Web Design and TFS Working knowledge of agile methodologies and software development lifecycles
Must have strong written communication, analytical, and interpersonal skills
This position requires the successful completion of a background investigation and/or drug screen.
Ciber Global is an Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Females/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.
Learn.
Talent Services bring clients a range of staffing solutions, from a single contractor to a team of experts to help achieve their key business goals on target and within budget. Our talent sourcing model uncovers the right IT talent and aligns critical skills with client technology, culture, and expectations.
Grow.
Ciber Global is an IT consulting company who partners with organizations to develop technology strategies and solutions that deliver tangible business value. Founded in 1974, Ciber is an HTC Global Services company. For more information, visit www.Ciber.com.

Profile

Title:

VP of Technology - Hands-on Leader:
Data, SQL, .net, Product

Location:

Nashville, TNSalary: $120,,000 Bonus Leads and directs the Technical Delivery department to ensure strategic and effective use of technology in support of operations and delivery of products and services. Ensures maximum system availability, data integrity and data security. Researches, recommends, and directs the implementation of new/improved technology to further the competitive position.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND

RESPONSIBILITIES Directs and manages the technology functions to ensure that systems, networks, hardware and telecommunications operate effectively.

Participates in IT project priority process and offers recommendations on scope and difficulty of proposed projects. Oversees the management of approved IT projects to ensure timely completion, effective testing, coordinated delivery and on-going communication with all stakeholders regarding project status and issues.

Ensures development of processing and backup procedures to safeguard system integrity and facilitate systems recovery. Ensures thorough and regular testing of backup processes. Directs the timely and accurate update of systems documentation and operations manuals.

Develops, updates, and ensures compliance with disaster recovery plans and systems security/loss prevention plans including maintaining active and robust antivirus and firewall protections.

Works with all our technology partners and the internal technology team to develop operational standards for IT functions and processes.

Directs development team in measuring and improving the productivity and efficiency of IT resources against standards. Encourages and implements continuing efficiencies in operational processes and functions.

Ensures timely and accurate diagnosis and resolution of network and system-related issues throughout the technology infrastructure to ensure maximum systems availability. Effectively communicates status of key issues and resolution efforts to Executive Management Team.

Consults with peer executives regarding opportunities to enhance operational efficiency or product delivery. Researches and recommends technology solutions in support of business plans and strategic goals.

Assesses the effectiveness of existing networks and telecommunication systems and recommends updates and changes to maximize efficiency and support future growth or changes within the abreast of changing trends in technology to include hardware, networks and network tools, software, IT security and systems. Uses broad knowledge and perspective to create competitive and breakthrough strategies and plans.

Negotiates cost effective contracts for systems, hardware, software, or peripherals including service warranties, maintenance programs or consultants. Develops effective partnerships with outsourced systems vendors and manages vendor performance against contracts.

Serves as central contact for both internal and external audit of critical systems and coordinates appropriate response to audit concerns. Ensures accurate and complete records of critical systems and systems that the department complies with all applicable federal, state, and local laws and regulations. Develops and revises procedures to assure adherence to established compliance policies

Ensures effective cascading communications throughout the IT department so that critical information, policies, procedures, and announcements are effectively and consistently shared.

Ensures effective collaborative communications between IT department and other divisions/departments so that issues can be resolved quickly and efficiently.

Directs the strategic development and management of the IT department in support

Prepares annual budget for the department and ensures that it operates within budget guidelines and monitors business unit’s performance to operate within DNI financial objectives.

Assists in the creation of technology project budgets for other business lines as needed.

Qualifications

Preferred banking partnership and discounted rates for home and auto loansMore job highlightsCollapseJob descriptionYou Matter

• Make a difference every day in the lives of the underserved• Join a mission driven organization with a people first culture• Excellent career growth opportunities...

Join us and find a career that supports:• Caring for overlooked, underserved, and vulnerable patients• Diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging• Autonomy in a warm team environment• Growth and training

Perks and Benefits In addition to comprehensive benefits including medical, dental, vision, paid time off, and 401k, we foster a work, life balance for team members and their family to support physical, mental, and financial wellbeing including: • DailyPay, receive your money as you earn it! • Tuition Assistance and dependent Scholarships• Employee Assistance Program (EAP) including free counseling and health coaching• Company paid life insurance• Tax free Health Spending Accounts (HSA)• Wellness program featuring fitness memberships and product discounts• Preferred banking partnership and discounted rates for home and auto loans

Why Us

Now is your moment to make a difference in the lives of the underserved. If there is one unifying characteristic of everyone on our team, it is the deep desire to make a difference by helping society's most vulnerable and often overlooked individuals. Every day we have the distinct honor and responsibility to show up with non-judgmental compassion to provide hope and healing to those who need it most. For those whose calling it is to serve others, now is your moment to join our mission to provide quality care to every patient with compassion, collaboration, and innovation, to live our mantra to “Always Do The Right Thing!”, and to collectively do our part to heal the world, one patient at a time.

How you make a difference

The role of a Senior AWS Software Engineer involves the implementation, upkeep, and assistance of enterprise-level software applications and databases. Additionally, they oversee both software development projects and the allocation of resources for these endeavors.

Key Responsibilities
• Analyze, define, and document system requirements for data, workflows, logical processes, interfaces, and controls.
• Manage daily operations for multiple projects, consulting with clients, and obtaining approvals.
• Write comprehensive program documentation, including logic, coding, testing, changes, and corrections.
• Provide training, coaching, and maintain professional relationships while promoting teamwork.
• Apply critical thinking, adaptability, and accountability, even under stress, in line with standardized procedures.

Qualifications & Requirements

Education
• Relevant Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university. Equivalent experience may be substituted for formal education.

Experience
• 7+ years of professional programming experience.
• Expertise in AWS tools such as Lambda, Step Functions, SQS, Aurora, DynamoDB, API Gateway, and S3.
• Expertise in C#, .Net Core, JavaScript, Angular JS, and SQL.
• Expertise in ASP.NET, WCF, WebAPI, MSMQ, and Nuget is a plus.
• Proven experience creating, executing and completing technical initiatives.
• Advance knowledge in cloud-based design patterns such as microservices, highly scalable frameworks, and strangle the monolith.
• Ability to effectively communicate advanced technical concepts to less experienced members of the development team.
• In-depth understanding of the current Microsoft development suite or similar tools.
• Experience developing browser-based software solutions.

Licenses/Certifications
• None

We are an Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer

We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

We encourage you to apply! If you are excited about a role but your experience doesn’t seem to align perfectly with every element of the job description, we encourage you to apply. You may be just the right candidate for this, or one of our many other rolesShow full descriptionCollapseReport this listingWellpathwellpathcare.comMore jobs at WellpathSee web results for Wellpath   Developer III  Sign in to save jobsSave a list of jobs that interest youCreate accountSign inWellpath  Nashville, TN, USA   via Wellpath WellpathFull-time

Team CivitasDX is seeking an API Software Developer to support the VA T4NG Consolidated Corporate Support Services (CCSS) program serving our Department of Veterans Affairs Corporate Portfolio clients across the entire U.S. The API Developer role will need to have SQL experience, understanding of Entity Framework (data access library for .NET), and an understanding of... LINQ and the transition of LINQ queries to SQL queries (LINQ is the query syntax in the C# language).

Responsibilities Include:
• ﻿Design, development, and testing of new features in the applications. Responsible for regular communication with others involved in the development process. Implement, test, and bug-fix functionality. Responsibility for design and implementation of software projects using C#
• Determines computer user needs; analyzes system capabilities to resolve problems on program intent, output requirements, input data acquisition, programming techniques and controls; prepares operating instructions; designs and develops autonomous services, desktop applications, web applications, scripts, and utility programs.
• Ensures software standards are met.
• Frequent use and application of technical standards, principles, theories, concepts and techniques.
• Receives assignments in the form of objectives and establishes goals to meet outlined objectives.
• Work is reviewed by supervisor/lead to measure meeting objectives.
• Provides solutions to a variety of technical problems of moderate scope and complexity where analysis of situations or data requires a review of a variety of factors.
• Works under general direction on routine work. May receive detailed instructions on new projects or assignments.
• Follows established procedures.
• Work is reviewed for soundness of technical judgment, overall adequacy and accuracy. Exercises judgement within defined procedures and practices to determine appropriate action.
• Contributes to completion of milestones associated with specific projects.

Required Skills:
• C#, Microsoft .Net
• Basic HTML5 and CSS3, JavaScript 5.x, TypeScript 4.x, Bootstrap 5.x, JQuery 3.6.x
• Visual Studio CODE (for development) and Visual Studio 2019 – 2022: Team Foundation Server
• Ability to write CLEAN, WELL FORMATTED CODE that well DOCUMENTED
• Application Programming Interface (API)
• Microsoft Structured Query Language (SQL) Server

Required Education, Experience, and Clearance:
• Bachelors and five (5) years or more experience, - OR –
• Ability to obtain a VA Position of Public Trust – Medium Background Investigation (MBI)

Desired Skills:
• Knowledge of Angular
• Strong analytical, verbal, and written communication skills
• Agile development methodology experience
• Experience with Microsoft Azure DevOps
• Self-starter with a positive attitude and very good interpersonal skills
• Strong work ethic with ability to self-manage workload and deliverables under tight deadlinesShow full descriptionCollapseReport this listingCognitive Medical Systemscognitivemedicalsystems.comMore jobs at Cognitive Medical SystemsSee web results for Cognitive Medical Systems  C .NET API Developer - Remote (WFH)  Sign in to save jobsSave a list of jobs that interest youCreate accountSign inCognitive Medical Systems  Oak Ridge, TN, USA   via Indeed15 days agoFull-time

This developer should have strong experience with .Net MVC, C# and MS-SQL and have experience solving complex programming challenges related to .Net development.

Location: Onsite Franklin, TN (Relocation after 3 months...

Must have skills in experience and resume:
• .Net 5
• Microservices
• Angular/React
• Even driven architecture.
• Asynchronous messaging technologies like Kafka, RabbitMQ, Azure Event Hubs
• Healthcare
• Cloud Azure

The Role:

Developer to work on .NET based applications.

Responsibilities:
• Design, develop and deploy new functionalities for applications using .NET stack
• Work with business units to refine requirements to enhancements existing or new functionalities
• Actively participate in design and development of new code
• Ensure design and development standards are current and being followed
• Develop scalable solutions to meet business needs

‘Must Have’ Experience:
• At least 7 years of experience in developing .NET applications.
• Must have strong hands-on experience in developing applications using C#, ASP.NET
• Knowledge of Microservice Architecture and Domain Driven Design is a must
• Familiar with Test Driven Development, with ability to write unit tests for the code developed
• Experience with Angular and/or REACT is highly desired.
• Microsoft Azure Devops experience
• Familiarity with coding standards like SOLID
• Hands on experience using Git Repository or any similar source controls.
• Good experience in using Microsoft development toolset.
• Good communication and collaboration skills
• Take part in agile development process.
• Strong critical / analytical thinking and problem-solving skills

‘Nice to Have’ Experience:
• Working experience in Event Driven Architecture
• Familiarity with tools for Containerization and environment as code like Docker, Mesos, Kubernetes
